thread.title: Scouting Oilers-Stars: Who's ready for McDavid vs Klingberg?
thread.title_full: Scouting Oilers-Stars: Who's ready for McDavid vs Klingberg? | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike Heika
title: Scouting Oilers-Stars: Who's ready for McDavid vs Klingberg?
text:
7:30 p.m. today. TV: FSSW. Radio: KTCK-AM (1310), KTCK-FM (96.7)
Storyline The Oilers bring in one of the youngest, fastest teams in the NHL, led by first overall draft pick Connor McDavid, but they have yet to win a game. Edmonton is 0-2-0 and has scored just one goal. The Stars' defense will be challenged by a hungry offensive team.
Key matchup: Connor McDavid vs. John Klingberg McDavid is the most celebrated rookie in the NHL after scoring 120 points (44 goals, 76 assists) in 47 games last season for Erie. He has yet to register a point and has four shots on goal in two games. Klingberg made the all-rookie team on defense last season and has one assist while averaging a team-leading 22:37 in time on ice in two games.
Key number: 11-1-2 That's the Stars' record against Edmonton at home over the last eight seasons.
Injuries Stars: None.
Oilers: RW Jordan Eberle (shoulder) is out.
Notable -- Edmonton is coming off a 2-0 loss Saturday in Nashville. Ex-New York Ranger Cam Talbot has stopped 52 of 56 shots, but Anders Nilsson could get the start in net.
-- Dallas is coming off a 6-3 loss Saturday in Colorado.
-- Kari Lehtonen could start in goal. He is 12-4-1 against the Oilers with a 2.34 GAA and a .923 save percentage.
-- Stars captain Jamie Benn has 20 points (11 goals, nine assists) in 19 career games against the Oilers.
